Since point $B$ lies within or on the square which has opposite corners at points $(4,2)$ and $(5,3)$, point $B$ lies to the right and below point $(5,3)$ in the bigger square ($ABCD$). This means that point $B$ lies inside or on the side of the bigger square ($ABCD$) between points $(5,3)$ and $(6,2)$, which is the side between points $(4,2)$ and $(5,3)$ of the smaller square ($BCEF$). Therefore, point $B$ lies inside or on the corner $(5,3)$ of the bigger square ($ABCD$). The answer is: $(5,3)$.
